name: Thorpe Park Hotel & Spa

reviews.text: we stayed here as part of my cousins hen weekend, and I can't praise the service we received highly enough. From the quality of the rooms, the food and service to the spa treatments even the gardens all were of the highest standard and we were made to feel really welcome.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The team that were on duty during our stay were amazing. We always really enjoy our stays there and think the affinity card is a really fantastic idea as it really feels like your getting some thing back from being loyal.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar staff were very attentive, friendly and helpful with out being in your face. The restaurant staff were very knowledgeable about the food they served and what wine would go well with the meals. Also it was nice they made recommendations on what was very very good as it meant that they had enjoyed the food too!
reviews.title: Not cheep but great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing that I think that Thorpe park could improve on is the TV's provided in the room as the rest of the hotel is so modern and 5 star, the old style TV's let the room down a little. But not enough to effect our stay.
reviews.title: Relaxed 30th birthday treat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed two nights after our wedding and the staff couldn't have been more helpful and kind. Had a very enjoyable and relaxing stay.
reviews.title: Nice, conveneient, great spa

reviews.text: This hotel is a tale of two halves. Firstly the rooms are comfortable and clean, the public areas are pleasant and well-looked after and the conference facilities are excellent. On the down-side, the service in the hotel really lets it down.
reviews.title: OK hotel - average service

reviews.text: My room had modern decor, a comfortable bed, a good selection of tea/coffee etc. and the bathroom was similar. There was a good-size desk for working and the wi-fi (free) easy to connect to and fairly quick. Food was OK - not outstanding - and the restaurant and bar were nice places to eat. The conference area has healthy food and snacks all day and the staff there really keep on top of refilling what's on offer.
reviews.title: Great business hotel

reviews.text: The biggest disappointment was the reception desk which to me is the shop window of any hotel. When you enter reception, there is often no one manning the desk - they seem to congregate behind a wall to the left of the desk. So the first impression is hardly welcoming. When someone arrives they are polite but not friendly, I had no offers to help with luggage to my room, reserve a table for dinner or anything. I also wanted to borrow a meeting room in the evening for 30 minutes to join a colleague for a conference call - the hotel wanted to charge for this (I have never been asked to pay for out of hours quick use of a meeting room before). Thankfully the general manager managed to sort me out for a FOC room. On check out, my bill had parking charges on (I had no car with me) and I know that other conference delegates had similar issues - I felt my bill was rather grudgingly corrected. The reception staff could often be seen walking around the hotel doing other things with grim looks on their faces. As they were clearly employees (the uniform and badges are a give away) they should focus more on looking more approachable and charming for their guests!
reviews.title: Friendly Service

reviews.text: Room service was OK - the only niggle with service is you are told when you phone that it is 25-30 minutes and then it turns up in 10. A bit embarrassing if you decide to have a shower while you are waiting!
reviews.title: Expectations surpassed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa here is very good and the service was friendly and helpful, can't fault it.
reviews.title: Very Nice....Great Rooms

reviews.text: We initially had a few problems with our initial booking but having spoken to the reservations manager everything was put right immediately and we were back on track for looking forward to our break.
reviews.title: SISTER/40TH BIRTHDAY SPA BREAK

reviews.text: When we arrived we had been upgraded to a suite, which we assumed were due to the initial mix up and boy did it surpass all expectations!! The room was light, modern, spacious and very well equipped and we were made very welcome from the onset.
reviews.title: Managers Staff Party

reviews.text: The spa treatment were excellent and the therapists very friendly. The food was gorgeous and well presented and again all the staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great experience and great value for money

reviews.text: The spa break at the outset appeared good value for money and it was that and much more when you considered the individual costs of the package. The only downside is that we found the drinks a little costly.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But a bit 10/10 and saving up for the next trip
reviews.title: Genuinely could not ask for more

reviews.text: I booked the girls night in package for my sisters 21st birthday gift. The package included a twin room bed breakfast and evening meal plus free rental of movies and use of the spa and swimming facilities. We had a really relaxed girly weekend and i would definitely recommend to other girls wanting to do the same.
reviews.title: Great packages available

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One night stay booked as a treat after a busy year where we didn't have time for a longer holiday. Priced reasonably. Service on reception very friendly and efficient. Car parking easy but can't remember if we had to pay for it.
reviews.title: Food for thought

reviews.text: The swimming pool/sauna area was fine - the steam room was out of order for part of the afternoon but this is a niggle rather than a disaster.
reviews.title: New Year at Thrope Park

reviews.text: The spa was very good and we both enjoyed a massage as an extra treat. A little expensive but treatment rooms, insurance, running costs and everything else has to be paid for I suppose - like any business. The bar was stylish yet welcoming with very good service and no need to wait to order at the bar. The nibbles of olives and crisps were welcome and of high quality. Beer (bitter) and wine (rose) both of good quality and not that expensive for an hotel.
reviews.title: Good Hotel pleasant staff

reviews.text: The meal in the restaurant was excellent. Aged balsamic vinegar was new to me and quite addictive. My main of steak was very tender indeed, to the extent that I wondered if it had been cooked sous vide? I don't know but it was tender and tasty whatever. Service excellent. I suspect many people visit the hotel just to go to the restaurant and that would make sense.
reviews.title: Great hotel, best in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just had a nice stay at this hotel. was only here for a night but have stayed here before and just as good the second time round. quick and simple check in, room was nice and clean with robes available and free milk and water....strangely also a free bottle of champers. The spa facilities are nice. I only used the pool, sauna etc...and found it all really good. Really well located just off the A1 too which was great. Breakfast was nice too. My only downpoint to the trip was the cup of tea i bought in the restaurant during the day - loose leaf tea in a pot - tasted awful.
reviews.title: Hassle free visit with nice pool and spa facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are spa members and as such get a discount off the restaurant. Visited in January, and whilst the restaurant was quite busy the food and service were very good. Nice to order and have the food delivered without the server asking who ordered what. They pride themselves on using local produce. Bread excellent. With the discount good value. Agree with the comments about the spa - not what it was, or should be.
reviews.title: restaurant very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in the middle of a gale - I checked in and before I got back to the car there were 2 members of staff begining to unload our luggage, which was in our room before we reached it. We experienced the same standard of service thoughout out 8 night stay. Every request was dealt with efficency and extreme friendliness. We were not disturbed by external or internal noise during the night, we slept very well, the housekeeping staff came back if it was not convenient to us to freshen up our room, requests for additional coffee were met with 'of course - is that enough'. The bar staff were very professional, we only requested our normal drinks once -on our day of arrival, from then on we were met with 'the same again' or 'your usual'. We found the selection and freshness of the breakfast excellent and once again the staff were extremely helpful and catered to our choices. When we entertained family & friends in the restaurant for evening meals & Sunday lunch they all commented on the high standard of the food. We used room service and the food arrived hot & within the stated time.
reviews.title: We will come again

reviews.text: We used the spa treatments and once again found the staff very friendly & helpful.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Leeds

reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and were not charged for car parking - Thorpe Park will be our future hotel choice when visiting the area to see our daughter.
reviews.title: What a disappointment

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights in an executive room paid on a business trip to leeds.
reviews.title: Excellent business hotel

reviews.text: Really enjoyed my stay, hotel was clean, staff were friendly, rooms were well appointed. Liked having a bose radio, fresh milk and cold water. Nice touches.
reviews.title: Best in Leeds

reviews.text: Found the bed comfy, and really enjoyed finally having feather pillows in a hotel.
reviews.title: Friendly and attentive.

reviews.text: Bathroom immaculate, shower hot and strong, and room service for a late night dinnerr was quick and freindly. In fact all the staff were efficient and friendly- couldn't have been more so actually, which was really nice.
reviews.title: The best service I have experienced in a long, long time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also enjoyed the small but more than adequate spa- didn't try any treatments, but used the gym and swimming pool- all better than usual for a hotel that doesn't tout itself as world class luxury.
reviews.title: Disabled accommodation

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Thorpe Park Hotel for one night for a conference with work. The hotel is well located and easy to find. The rooms are lovely and the beds are just so comfy. The bathroom has both a large bath and a walk in shower with lots of added extras. We didn't get chance to use the spa unfortunately but it looked lovely.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: Our evening was so well organised and a particular thank you to all the excellent staff is needed; they were all so friendly and helpful. All in all a great hotel, thanks.
reviews.title: Fabulous time with the girls!!!!! Can't wait for the next one ^________^

reviews.text: As soon as we arrive...OMG!!!!! It's fabulous, the exterior and interior well presented. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful to all our needs. Felt like VIP treatment. Me and my friends booked it for a girly day and night which is the special offer until the end of this year.
reviews.title: Faultless as usual.
Thanks again, great stay
reviews.text: We had a very nice executive room, very big, neat and tidy, modern, and comfortable. We spent the day relaxing around the pool, sauna, and spa. There is also a good fitness centre that you can work out before going to the relaxation area if you want to. Upstairs, there is a spa facilities and also the relaxing room with complimentary tea and coffee.
In the evening, we were served with a set of Tapas, popcorn, ice cream, fresh strawberries, and a choice of classic movies to watch in our room. In the morning, breakfast was tremendous!!!!!
reviews.title: A real surprise - great hotel

reviews.text: Stay at the Thorpe at least once a month - spacious and well presented rooms, very friendly and helpful staff, excellent food and good pool/ gym facilities.
reviews.title: Always an Excellent Stay

reviews.text: From booking this accommodation the staff at this hotel have been amazing nothing was too much trouble and everything was organised for our 'Girls night in' prior to arrival. The hotel was lovely and the rooms really nice the Spa staff and treatments were equally amazing. We had 12 in our party and everyone will be returning here - fantastic time had by all!
reviews.title: An absolutely amazing time had by all at this hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed at Thorpe Park as we were guests at a wedding and the reception was held there.
reviews.title: Smart hotel

reviews.text: I could not fault the place, room spacious and really comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Another fantastic stay at this lovely hotel

reviews.text: The spa looked great.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but pool too busy we lasted 5 minutes

description: Located just to the east of Leeds, the 4 star Thorpe Park Hotel and Spa's perfectly placed for discovering all the delights of Yorkshire. Step inside this stylish and contemporary hotel and you'll sense flavours of the Mediterranean. The stunning internal courtyard, in French limestone, is a natural centrepiece - with a glass atrium that allows the daylight to dance around the interior of the building.
